metadata.Title: CVE-2018-16882 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free issue was found in the way the Linux kernel's KVMhypervisor processed posted interrupts when nested(=1) virtualization isenabled. In nested_get_vmcs12_pages(), in case of an error while processingposted interrupt address, it unmaps the 'pi_desc_page' without resetting'pi_desc' descriptor address, which is later used inpi_test_and_clear_on(). A guest user/process could use this flaw to crashthe host kernel resulting in DoS or potentially gain privileged access to asystem. Kernel versions before 4.14.91 and before 4.19.13 are vulnerable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16882` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
